structured.title: User and Exactly Discuss Catechism Structure
structured.overview: The User and Exactly chat informally while waiting for food, then discuss how to structure part two of a simple Christian catechism. The User proposes restarting numbering at question one for each part instead of continuing from question 19, thinking it will feel less intimidating and easier to track (e.g., part two question two instead of question nineteen). Exactly considers whether restarting numbering might reduce continuity with the first 18 questions but also notes it could give people a sense of a fresh start. The User mentions preparing catechism cards alongside other responsibilities and expresses worry that they are failing the church, but Exactly reassures them, saying no one thinks that and that the only possible critics are people who like ideas but don’t attend when events actually happen.

apps_results.content:
## Discussion on Catechism Structure  
- Part one had 18 questions total  
- Idea: reset numbering to question 1 for each part  
- Goal: make it less intimidating, easier to track  

## Pros and Cons of Renumbering  
- Pros: “Part 2, Q2” clearer than “Q19”  
- Might help people restart if they missed earlier questions  
- Concern: less direct link to previous 18 questions  

## Workload and Church Perception  
- User preparing catechism cards among other tasks  
- User feels like church is failing them  
- Reassurance: no one actually thinks church is failing  

## Attendance and Commitment Insight  
- Only non-attenders might criticize ideas  
- Those wanting more prayer often don’t show up  
- Implication: current efforts are adequate and faithful  

## Next Steps  
- Decide definitively on question numbering format  
- Finish and distribute catechism cards for part two  
- Continue activities without overvaluing absent critics
